text: Hi <@UGY22E2KC>, thank you for letting us know. Can you also provide some information, if or when we will be able to use such endpoints in the future?

It’s currently not possible.

You can get a full look at all of the special data associated with the quote by doing `{{ template_data|pprint }}`
Theoretically though you could store user photos in a HubDB and check if the selected user is a person listed in the HubDB, display that image.

why doesn’t {% if site_settings.state or site_settings.zip %} work? each one, individually, works, but as soon as I put “or” in, the DM says it can’t resolve either property. I need this for a nested if/else block. I was hoping not to have to break it down individually and write redundant actions.

Oh, gotcha! I saw the avatars on a few of HubSpot’s custom quotes and figured we probably had the same ability.

Thanks for clearing that up!
